Chronological.Definition: following the order in which the events happened

Patient.Definition: able to accept the difficulties of such a journey
Patient.Definition (Cambridge automatic): the ability to wait , or to continue doing something despite difficulties , or to suffer without complaining or becoming annoyed :

Reign.Definition: period of being a king, ruling
Reign.Definition (Cambridge automatic): to be the king or queen of a country :

Mere.Definition (Cambridge automatic): used to emphasize that something is not large or important :

Remarked.Definition (Cambridge automatic): to give a spoken statement of an opinion or thought :

Innate.Definition (Cambridge automatic): An innate quality or ability is one that you were born with, not one you have learned :

Tendency.Definition: habit, something that we are very likely to do
Tendency.Definition (Cambridge automatic): If someone has a tendency to do or like something, they will probably do it or like it:

Astute.Definition (Cambridge automatic): able to understand a situation quickly and see how to take advantage of it:

Genetic.Definition: relating to genes (parts of the DNA) received from our parents
Genetic.Definition (Cambridge automatic): belonging or relating to genes (= parts of the DNA in cells) received by each animal or plant from its parents :

Upbringing.Definition (Cambridge automatic): the way in which you are treated and educated when young , especially by your parents , especially in relation to the effect that this has on how you behave and make moral decisions :

Touches on.Definition (Cambridge automatic): to mention a subject quickly when speaking or writing about another subject :

Heir.Definition: the next person to have this position
Heir.Definition (Cambridge automatic): a person who will legally receive money , property , or a title from another person , especially an older member of the same family , when that other person dies :

Remotely.Definition: slightly, in a very small way

Resembling.Definition (Cambridge automatic): to look like or be like someone or something:

Monarch-in-waiting.Definition: someone who was going to be king

Throne.Definition (Cambridge automatic): the special chair used by a ruler , especially a king or queen

Boarding school.Definition: a school where students study but also live
Boarding school.Definition (Cambridge automatic): a school where students live and study

Toughen.Definition (Cambridge automatic): to make something or someone tough , strong , or stronger :

Strained.Definition (Cambridge automatic): If a relationship is strained, problems are spoiling it:

Absent.Definition (Cambridge automatic): the fact of not being where you are usually expected to be:

Inferior.Definition (Cambridge automatic): not good, or not as good as someone or something else :

Glamorous.Definition (Cambridge automatic): attractive in an exciting and special way:
